issue.title: Inconsistent bit operations returning a count

discussion.p:
Among the bit operations returning a count, bit_width() is the only one not returning an int.
This has the following consequences:
The last line may result in a warning such as:

blockquote.p: Warning: conversion from long long unsigned to int may change value

discussion.p:
You have to use a static_cast to avoid the warning.
Note that explicitly states the following design considerations, which I would also assume to apply to the later added functions from :

blockquote.p: The counting operations return "int" quantities, consistent with the rule "use an int unless you need something else". This choice does not reflect, in the type, the fact that counts are always non-negative.

blockquote.pre: […] template<class T> constexpr Tint bit_width(T x) noexcept; […]
[…] template<class T> constexpr Tint bit_width(T x) noexcept; […]

blockquote.p:
-11- Constraints: T is an unsigned integer type ().
-12- Returns: If x == 0, 0; otherwise one plus the base-2 logarithm of x, with any fractional part discarded.
